channel.title: Good Linux Distro / Overall OS?
channel.description:
Alright guys so I'm kind of hoping for a speedy reply so I can download the OS/whichever Linux Distro I need and go on with my day. I am also aware this has been asked alot but I need an answer for my specific needs. So I feel the need for a new OS in general, whether it's just something new and different or if you give me a good linux distro, I don't care. Here are some things I'm going to need:
-A rather user friendly OS, I tried a linux distro once (forgot the name) and honestly I was baffled at how to do ANYTHING. -I need something very good for gaming and game development, as well as general use, skype etc. I am aware that some Linux platforms aren't necessarily friendly with daily applications such as skype, etc, so of course I need something that doesnt have many issues with those.
And that's about it guys, I know it's very specific, and I realize I couldve just searched for this answer, but I know alot of you guys use different linux distros etc so I wanted a good answer from some of you. Thanks.
EDIT: I just remembered Ubuntu and I believe.. 12.0 or something like that was the version I had previously used. So if anyone thinks thats something good to use, just send me in the direction of a maybe helpful website, or just give me some friendly tips to get used to it.

item.title: Good Linux Distro / Overall OS?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

http://distrowatch.com/table.php?

item.title: Good Linux Distro / Overall OS?
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

I hate to break it to you but you pretty much described windows man, you might as well just keep/install windows. I guess the closest runner up with be Ubuntu, or maybe mint i suppose

Read full topic
